Params: {3: 'The black sky swallows what little light and hope you have left.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Emma', 3: "...Our speed is about 6-7 kilometers per hour. The coordinates are confirmed. We're still heading to Aerospace City.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Resources are low, the Mutated Red Tide is out of control, and most electronics are down, so you are navigating the old-fashioned way.'}
{3: 'The terminal shuts off, and the last light goes out.'}
{3: 'Everyone walks in silence, leaving only the crunch of boots on snow.'}
{3: 'These are the last people from Great Tombstone. When they get to Aerospace City, Great Tombstone will go back to its old name.'}
{2: 'Have Vanessa and Discord caught up yet?', 3: '20'}
{3: "The terminal's dim light flickers on, lighting up Emma's face."}
{2: 'Emma', 3: "Soon. They've joined up with the last patrol and collection squads. They'll be here shortly.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Emma', 3: 'So, Commandant, about the Punishing Virus concentration dropping... Was it Luna...?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She shuts off the terminal, saving power, and the light goes out again.'}
{3: 'You have gotten used to death in these freezing nights, but you still hesitate to say the word.'}
{2: 'Luna gave humanity a chance to escape.', 3: '34'}
{3: 'After you and Vanessa left, she faced the new Agent Zero again. The Punishing Virus concentration spiked—probably meaning Agent Zero was winning—but then...'}
{3: 'Like she promised, she helped you one last time, buying you and humanity some precious "time".'}
{3: 'Cold creeps up from the ground. Your breath hangs in the air. Nearby, others overhear you.'}
{2: 'Refugee 2', 3: "The Great Tombstone's gone too. Will Aerospace City be next...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Refugee 2', 3: 'If this keeps going... Do we have any chance left...', 4: '2'}
{3: "The cold bites harder. Thinly dressed, the humans' voice shakes."}
{3: 'To calm them, Barniga rubs her frozen hands and takes out the instrument strapped to her back.'}
{3: 'As the wind and snow seem to play the strings, a soft melody starts. To ease their worry, Barniga sings that familiar song.'}
{2: 'Barniga', 3: '～To awaken or sleep forever. Who can say...～', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Barniga', 3: "～Even the worst storms can't break what's inside us...～", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Without any music, that sad war song hits you right in the gut.'}
{3: "She's sung this around the fire so many times. Every human here knows it by heart."}
{3: "Snow whispers down from the branches. In the quiet crowd, someone starts singing along, like they can't help it."}
{2: 'Lyrics', 3: "～Though the night drags on, a new dawn's coming.～"}
{2: 'Lyrics', 3: "～Let's sing with hope in our hearts.～"}
{3: 'The flare bursts into flames, bright light slicing through the darkness below.'}
{2: 'Lyrics', 3: '～A rusty blade bites into a palm.～'}
{2: 'Lyrics', 3: '～Scars turn into trenches. We find rebirth in our breaking...～'}
{3: 'No one says a word, but the song keeps going, burning through the silent, suffering ground like that flare in their hands.'}
{3: 'In the fading glow of the flames, the city walls appear and disappear through the wind and snow.'}
{3: "After what feels like an eternity of trudging, you finally see Aerospace City's gates again."}
{3: "Once inside the city, Emma's busy getting the newcomers settled, while Rosa walks up to you by the gate."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: "Commandant, I've got some good news and some bad news. Which do you want first?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'That Hetero-Core Shard... the one we pulled from those Hetero-Creatures? I managed to crack the data inside.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "It's got an analysis of the Hetero Tower core. And with what I decoded before...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'I can just barely whip up some souped-up "filters", like the old CPF. They\'ll temporarily clean up the mutated Punishing Virus and Red Tide.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "I can't promise the virus won't keep changing, but it'll buy us some time.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'I wouldn\'t exactly call it "bad" news, it\'s just...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Exploring this Mutated Red Tide has already sucked up so many resources and people. Do we really need to keep at it?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "Using the info from that Hetero-Core Shard you risked everything for, I've managed to combine it with the earlier bits of the Hetero Tower core.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'I can just barely whip up some souped-up "filters", like the old CPF. They\'ll temporarily clean up the mutated Punishing Virus and Red Tide.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'But... you know, this has taken forever. No supplies, no gear, not even a proper lab...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Maybe we could find some kind of solution in the Mutated Red Tide, but... is it worth it?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "It's a constant drain of time, supplies, and people, and on top of that...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'A new Agent Zero, a new Red Tide consciousness... I can barely even get their basic makeup with what we have.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'If Mr. Asimov was still here, he might be able to figure all this out, but...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She goes quiet, then speaks again after a moment.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: "We've got the answer from the Heteromer Shard, so why not keep digging into the Hetero Tower core? If humanity had truly safe havens, wouldn't that be a way to survive?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Do we keep exploring the Mutated Red Tide? Or do we focus on the Hetero Tower core to build a safer settlement?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Temporarily stop Red Tide exploration. (Unlocks Ending: Tomorrow)', 3: '169', 4: 'Continue exploring the Red Tide.', 5: '323', 12: '-1', 13: '-1'}
{3: 'You study the experimental data, lost in thought.'}
{3: 'Like Rosa said, exploring the Mutated Red Tide has used a lot of people and supplies.'}
{3: 'Compared to thirty years ago, it might seem small, but today... even a grain of wheat is hope, let alone this much.'}
{3: 'Rosa stares silently at the inventory list, trailing to the floor.'}
{3: 'Vanessa rushes in, overhearing the end of the conversation.'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Even if humanity cracked the Hetero Tower core and got a perfect Punishing Virus filter... then what?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Build a bunker and hide inside, waiting?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "But humans can't fight back right now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Emma says... the Great Tombstone settlement is about to be swallowed by the Red Tide.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Did you... bring any good news? Like... more supplies, or... a better campsite?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Rosa looks at Vanessa, half desperate, half pleading.'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Lately... how much have the patrols and collection squads brought back?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The question hits hard, and Vanessa falls silent.'}
{3: "Most areas outside the settlement are overrun by the Mutated Red Tide and high Punishing Virus level. The collection squads haven't found anything useful in ages."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Even a bunker gives humanity a fighting chance. But if we keep going like this...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "I'm afraid we'll lose any hope of survival.", 4: '1'}
{2: "We're just slowing down research on the Mutated Red Tide, not throwing in the towel.", 3: '207'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "Yes, we're just slowing down for now.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She speaks softly, as if telling a bedtime story beside a cradle.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Aerospace City has a "filter" that can block the current Punishing Virus strain.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "Once we get the Hetero Tower core's data, we might get new weapons, new resources...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Then we can explore the Mutated Red Tide again and find what we need.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Throughout Aerospace City, tired settlers try to organize their few belongings in run-down homes.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Discord and the patrol members have just returned, all badly injured.'}
{3: 'The Mutated Red Tide ruins water and everything humans need. Just staying alive is a struggle...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: "I know time's running out... but humanity can't afford the cost anymore.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "The settlements... It's been years since we heard children crying.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: "Without safe land, they won't bring new life into the world.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'I can ignore the lost supplies, and so can you, but... what about humanity?', 4: '1'}
{3: "After looking at Emma's resource data, it's clear Rosa's right."}
{3: 'The point of the Red Tide exploration is to fight back, but now...'}
{3: "Supplies are dwindling, you are losing people, and Agent Zero's getting stronger."}
{3: "You are still losing. Even throwing everyone at the problem wouldn't make a dent in the Red Tide."}
{3: "You can't fight back right now, not anytime soon."}
{2: 'We should slow down our Mutated Red Tide exploration for now.', 3: '265'}
{3: 'She scoffs, drops a final line, and walks away.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Don't forget, Earth used to be ours.", 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: "Vanessa's always wanted to take back all the lost land... not just the Great Tombstone, but everywhere.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'I get it... I just hope she comes to her senses.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Snow comes down in thick flurries as the biting wind whips Rosa's hand-written inventory of losses."}
{3: "The printer's been out of ink for ages."}
{2: "What's the supply situation inside Aerospace City?", 3: '295'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: "After finding Nanami's inventory, I checked the supplies.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'The remaining humans and Constructs have enough food and supplies to last a while.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "I've got people building greenhouses. Once they're stable, we can grow crops. That should keep us alive.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As Rosa explains, her eyes show uncertainty.'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'Maybe we can hold out until we crack the Hetero Tower core.', 4: '1'}
{2: "It's not completely out of the question, I think.", 3: '306', 4: 'Of course we can.', 5: '304'}
{3: 'Her voice shakes a little, but Rosa keeps reassuring herself.'}
{3: 'The dilapidated Aerospace City, a shadow of human civilization.'}
{3: 'Living off makeshift greenhouses, humanity barely survives, hanging on by a thread.'}
{3: 'But like a paper boat on burning water, no one knows how long this fragile civilization will last.'}
{3: 'Rosa works tirelessly. Humanity guards Aerospace City, constantly improving its "filter" and barely surviving on data from the Hetero Tower core.'}
{3: 'But as time goes on, no one can stop the new Agent Zero.'}
{3: 'The paper boat sails on across the burning sea...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Give up on the Red Tide? And put all our lives and choices in the hands of a "filter" we don\'t even know will last?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Vanessa, looking worn and weary, catches the tail end of your conversation.'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: "But humanity can't keep hanging on by a thread...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'At least... we need to find out who our real enemy is.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'She stares coldly at the outskirts of Aerospace City, where the Mutated Red Tide crawls over human civilization, sucking up Earth\'s "nutrients" like a leech.'}
{2: "Besides, even if we're just barely hanging on...", 3: '346'}
{2: 'Rosa', 3: 'I can build a greenhouse, using what we have...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Even if we secure all of Aerospace City, then what? Live like rats forever inside these high walls?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Don't forget... Earth used to be ours.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Hot blood clouds your vision. Your consciousness starts fading as Hetero-Creatures' screeches echo in your head. You see something, but you can't quite grasp it..."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosa', 3: 'But it all comes at a cost...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Even... if the cost is your life?', 3: '390'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Hmph... Anyone who's made it this far isn't a coward.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'She breathes heavily. After a few deep breaths, she calms down.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I've... grown to hate this way of life.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Outside the window, snow falls hard, crashing against the ground.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Hiding, running, trapped in one walled-off settlement after another...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "If this is the future of human civilization, I'd rather destroy it than let it happen.", 4: '2'}
{2: "You can't give up on studying the Red Tide.", 3: '414'}
{3: 'Lucia, Nanami, and so many others are fighting for the "future". How can you just stand still?'}
{3: "The world can't stop here. Only by truly understanding your enemy can you find the answer."}
{2: "We've lost Luna's control of the Red Tide.", 3: '435'}
{1: '1', 3: "Chaos is gone, and no one can contain the Mutated Red Tide. It's constantly changing, and the new Agent Zero is watching."}
{2: "Just giving in won't unlock the Hetero Tower core's secrets.", 3: '443'}
{3: "Aerospace City's resources are limited. Even with greenhouses and food storage, what about everything else?"}
{3: "Construct fluid and spare parts, human serums and medicine. How do you replace things you can't make here?"}
{3: 'As your lab equipment breaks down, where do you get new replacements?'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "With no way out, we've got to take charge.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "People will die. I don't care if it's me, but I'll never stop fighting, as long as I still draw breath.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "Humans... are free. We can't become trapped animals, waiting to die.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'After a quick talk, you decide to ask for volunteers from the patrols and Constructs to keep getting Red Tide samples and doing research.'}
{3: 'Surprisingly, as soon as you asked, people lined up from the lab to the street.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vanessa leans against the lab, watching the line with an enigmatic look.'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: "I thought it'd just be us, but I heard them talking about it last night.", 4: '1'}
{3: "She looks at the street, lit by makeshift lamps, where people's faces show hope and worry."}
{3: 'Nobody wants to be trapped behind walls forever.'}
{3: "Once they've seen the light, how can they go back to darkness?"}
{3: 'Even if it means death, humanity will stand tall and write its own story.'}
{3: 'Billions of years later, future civilizations will see their strength and their battles.'}
{3: 'Even wounded, even with no ammo and no supplies—'}
{2: 'As long as there are humans left.', 3: '483'}
